posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
First of all, welcome to the forums darknight!

Now to the build itself... You want to keep almost authentic the look of what you did in the past but with a good optimization, am i right?

Levels must also remain the same since undispellable and HS plus WM yield a 28/5/7 split which is exactly what you did.

From the first looks of it, you might want to start with: (STR 14  DEX 13  CON 12  INT 13  WIS 16  CHA 08), then you should focus on rising your strength with just two bumps in wisdom and let the two epic bonus Druid feats finish your wisdon to a nice, even 20. In place of zen archery and toughness you should take two additional Great Strength feats in order to help your AB since the original 34 is way to low even for a spell-sword. Keep blind-fight of course since it's not replace-able from true sight and get the rest of the combat feats as you have done. with those few changes your end-game raw stats should look like this: (STR 24  DEX 13  CON 12  INT 13  WIS 20  CHA 08). It is a significant improvement if i might say but you are still hampered from the presence of HS levels pre-epic and therefore you lose another valuable point of AB. It's alright though since this is a Role -Playing build primarily, and it should play nicely.

* You might also want to look into Fighter instead of Weapon Master, yes i know i state the obvious but i just saw that you don't even have Heavy Armour proficiency and of course WM doesn't give any. The build would work so much more smoothly with Fighter instead of Weapon Master. And you could also change the Race to Elves since there would not be feat shortage of any kind. Just food for thought ;)

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
I'm headed in the same general direction as Valerfor but it still is a nasty exercise no matter how you split it.  HS really mucks up the potential badly.  Anyhoo, trying to keep as close to your original class split which actually is about optimized "as is" seeing as how there's no room to extend spells so you'll still get some mileage out of Blood Frenzy and Creeping Doom...

Elven Neutral build, STR: 14 (24), DEX: 13, CON: 12, WIS: 16 (19), INT: 13, CHA: 8.  That'll provide enough skillpoints to meet all the prereqs, max Disc, SpCrft & Tumble with 46 to spread as you like.

Elf is going to cost you zen archery in this build unless you start to prune away from AB & damage (pretty silly, though, since you are taking FEs to boost anyway). There's really no point in trying to maintain two different sources of AB.  It's a losing battle using all feat-starved classes. IMO without a monk infusion of some sort, high-WIS is just wasted. Else, go human like you did before and use Owl's Insight to reach the ability cap.

Pre-epic
Bumps :: @4,8,16,20 +4STR, @12 +1WIS
Druid 1-16 :: WF: Scimi, Dodge,Expertise,Mobility,Spring Attack,Whirlwind Attack
WM 17-20 :: WoC, Blind fight
BAB @16 is 4 APR

Epic
Bumps :: all to STR (+5)
WM 21-23 :: EWF
Druid 24-34 :: Imp Crit, Alertness, Iron will, Armor skin, bonus - Grt WIS
HS 35-38 :: FE, Grt STR
Druid 39 (spcrft dump) :: Epic prowess, bonus - Grt WIS
HS 40 (disc dump) :: FE

It still ain't pretty but reaches an unbuffed AB of 38 and AC 29 w/armor-shield.  Yeah, I know you won't be casting level 8 or 9 spells until the late bonus feats kick in.  It's possible to move the bonuses up some if you would rather delay the juicy WM boosts until later.  Your decision.  I'd just survive with Level 7 spells and use summons if needed in the interim.

Hope the roleplay is worth it, SmkNThDrkNght.  Best I can scrape together on the fly.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
You should use whatever priority you wish to sculpt a roleplay build to best suit your desires.

Key interactions I see in the split chosen are: 
  • reaching BAB 16 in pre-epic, not only for the best AB, but best APR
  • infusing the increased multiplier and expanded crit range for your weapon as soon as possible (i.e.WM7)
  • empowering the offensive capabilities with high-level divine spellcasting in time to deal with increased CR
  • obtaining the best overall combat skill levels with some room to develop secondary skills a bit (stealth and detection prowess is beyond the scope of this build) 
If you decide a high priority on HS, then take four levels in pre-epic.  It doesn' t matter how you spread them out, optimization is Dru16/HS4.  That'll drop AB one notch with APR now at 3.  Feat selection will need to modified, of course. WM will bloom in epic as a consequence.

If waiting until epic levels for HS is acceptable, you can take the first HS at 21 if you sacrifice two of the WM prereq feats in pre-epic for the HS ones. Then HS will register it's influence RP-wise and get an early tumble dump (well, earlier than level 35 anyway).  However, WM will mature slower since you'll still need to fulfill prereqs, now in epic levels, as will the available spells. Spread the next 3 HS dumps out as preferred, saving HS5 for level 40.

It's actually pretty cut-'n-dried when preferences have been as thoroughly detailed as you have done.  There's a cause-effect consequence for every choice you make that cannot be magically-avoided with some exploit... unless it's high magic PW with items that provide feats, abilities, extra spell levels, etc. that severely dilute class definition.  WoG is not that, though, and adheres to the AD&D ruleset like it still matters (as I'm sure you are fully aware).
